channel.title: japan on Jacob Proffer
channel.description: Recent content in japan on Jacob Proffer

item.title: Japan Blog 11
item.description: My interest with Osaka started with an action-adventure game called Yakuza 0. The game takes place in 1988 and is set in Tokyo’s Kabukichō and Osaka’s Dōtonbori.

item.title: Japan Blog 10
item.description: I’ve never flown domestically within another country before this trip to Japan. I was unsure of what the process would be like.

item.title: Japan Blog 09
item.description: This is it. Tomorrow morning, I embark on my second trip to Japan. For the next week, I’ll explore Osaka, Kyoto and Nara.

item.title: Japan Blog 08
item.description: As much I hated to return the room key, I checked out of the Hotel Gracery on Monday morning around eight.

item.title: Japan Blog 07
item.description: For the final full day in Tokyo, Japan, I wanted to visit Ikebukuro for the Pokémon Center and revisit Akihabara.

item.title: Japan Blog 06
item.description: Saturday in Tokyo was unique. I slept in for once, which provided an opportunity to seek breakfast somewhere other than Burger King.

item.title: Japan Blog 05
item.description: Friday morning, I was out the door by seven. Breakfast was at Burger King, my new usual spot in Shinjuku.

item.title: Japan Blog 04
item.description: I woke around three in the morning. Through the window in the hotel room, I could see that the night life was still active down the block.

item.title: Japan Blog 03
item.description: It was dark when the train pulled out of Narita. I did not expect this.

item.title: Japan Blog 02
item.description: Immigration is a strange place to be alone, especially if you don’t speak the native language.

item.title: Japan Blog 01
item.description: 6265 miles. That’s how far I had to travel to get to Tokyo, Japan. Thankfully, I managed to due so in comfort aboard an American Airlines Boeing 787 Dreamliner.

item.title: Japan Blog 00
item.description: This is it. Tonight is my last full night within the United States, at least for the next week.
